name: Semana de la Ciencia y Tecnología
description: Scientific activities for kids and general public in different venues in the Madrid Comunity
address: Museo Nacional Ciencias Naturales, Madrid, Spain

name: TechWomen
description: TechWomen empowers, connects and supports the next generation of women leaders in STEM from Africa, Central and South Asia, and the Middle East through mentorship and exchange

name: Codette Stories
description: A meetup that promotes women technologists - open for all! More info on the speakers and their presentations: https://www.facebook.com/events/156588191747052/
address: TechHub Bucharest, 39-41 Nicolae Filipescu, Bucharest, Romania

name: IoT4Girls
description: A workshop for high school girls, where in just 2 days the participants build a piano that they control from a web page. More details on the schedule and how to apply here: https://www.facebook.com/events/776786975857870/

name: Mujeres Nobel
description: Exhibition on a selection of 12 women that have received the Nobel Prize in every category since its inception. The objective to raise awareness in society on the role of women in many disciplines and their contribution.
address: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales. C/ José Gutiérrez Abascal, 2. Madrid. Spain.

name: #Enclase 11F
description: Activities for the International Day of Girls and Women in Science.

name: Mujeres por Africa - 'Science by Women'
description: Yearly program to empower african women scientist by networking with centers and labs in Spain. Exchange fellowship program of up to 6 months of duration.

name: Women in Science Office
description: We run bi-monthly seminars on women gender issues
address: Madrid, Spain - Spanish National Cancer Research Center (CNIO) Auditorium

name: WoW Sri Lanka
description: WOW – Women of the World festival celebrates women and girls, and looks at the obstacles that stop them from achieving their potential.

name: Grace Hopper 2018
description: The Grace Hopper Celebration is the world's largest gathering of women technologists. It is produced by AnitaB.org and presented in partnership with ACM. GHC 18 will be Sep. 26–28 in Houston, TX.

name: Grand opening of the science bookstore GalDar
description: A joint venture by 60 science communicators. Curating feminism science books, hosting Techno Feminism seminars, and running The Pink Lab. Launching the Naver podcast Jin Joo Lee's Hidden Figures, sharing books and stories of women scientists.

name: Father and Daughter over-night Robot Camp for elementary school students
Ada Lovelace Celebration 2017, an ACM Celebration Event
description: On Friday, we have a full day lined up with several talks from industry and academia, including career-related, inspirational and technical talks. We bring together talks from powerful women in the tech industry and research. Our keynote speaker, Maral Kalajian from Watty, also known as, ‘Maral from Twitter’, ‘Powerhouse’, 'energy pack' or ‘Curly’ is one of the most familiar faces in the Stockholm tech scene. Maral was listed as among the 100 most influential names in the Scandinavian startup scene by tech site The Nordic Web in 2016, and will give a talk on Obsession is the reward - In life, it all comes down to what we want, how much we want it and our willingness to go all in to get it. Everything else is detail.
